lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed. Tonight, we are sadly down one Sam Riegel, because apparently he has priorities.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I actually don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Watching his kids!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that where he's at?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know where he is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know where he is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's weird. Well--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know? I just don't remember where he is--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is his mother's name!?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is his mother's name!?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's Lenore! I know it. It's Scanlan's mom--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't care about his past!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What am I doing Thursday night!? (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's not that we don't remember, we just don't care.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughs) Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But we love you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's true. That's hilarious because it's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But Taliesin, did you have anything you wanted to say?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a big anniversary for them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it's Puzzle Quest's ten-year anniversary.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Marvel and Puzzle Quest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're not Sam Riegel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not Sam Riegel!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're not Sam Riegel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm doing my best! I was just given this! I thought he was going to be here! We brought his things out. I thought he was going to be here! And now I have this, and I have to somehow--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you just play on his harmonica, or something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not touching that. I know where it's been.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a hard truth that only one of us is irreplaceable.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's so true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's sad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can say that I do love comic books. I love three-jewel replacement games that I can play on airplanes--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And Marvel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: -- and when I wanna pretend to listen to my family over Christmas. It's great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're killing it, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know, and I suddenly realised a couple of them watch the show, and now they know that I'm not really texting you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Taliesin pulls out a curly blonde wig and--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And starts jamming candy bars in his mouth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But, Marvel Puzzle Quest is great, because it's all the fun of the three-gem, Bejeweled-style games, but you would also collect characters if you're a big nerd like I am, and they've got basics like Thor and Iron Man, and new fun ones, like Ms. Marvel, and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about Black Widow? Do they have Black Widow?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They have Black Widow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hell yeah, they do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Black Widow is actually one of the first ones I ever got, but they've also got crazy ones-- they've got Devil Dinosaur. That's nuts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's pretty intense, actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's pretty nuts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do they have Slapstick?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm even more embarrassed that I know you now. It was already bad. This is why you're never going to be on my show, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cries) I know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's exactly why.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But yeah. Marvel Puzzle Quest. Thank you guys. You can get it on Steam, Amazon App Store, Google Play, Apple Store-- it's all over the place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay, thanks, Marvel Puzzle Quest!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Next up!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have any merch updates? Or are we just still kicking ass in the store?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (high-pitched) Hey, there's stuff in the store, you guys! You should go look in the store and see what is there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. Thank you, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was adorable. We have Wondercon coming up! Which we're excited about. It's for you guys who are able to come to Wondercon, Anaheim, California, April 1st on Saturday, we're having our Talks Machina live panel from 2-3PM in the Arena, the big room there, and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come to Anaheim, 4,000 seats!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, big seats!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trying to fill the room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Comfy seats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because if we manage to fill the room, we can use that as an example as to why we have good crowds, and we can hopefully do more events in more places in the country, or around the world! And see you guys in person.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We want to see everyone within a reasonable driving or flying distance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, Taliesin and I are going to fistfight until one of us is dead or unconscious.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to break a pool cue.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: While drunk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's new. I didn't--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's going to be epic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! So that's a thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just roll with it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: See that-- yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Got a lot of pent-up aggression, Tal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm ready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want a bruise, right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: April 1st.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) I want a bruise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 2PM at Wondercon, our panel, and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Critical Brawl. We just barefist it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Speaking of Taliesin unconscious-- Wednesday Club!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, god! That's right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Great one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was a weird time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it was a weird time. It's getting cooler now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like when people talk about DC Comics, they just only vaguely talk about DC Comics these days.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're gonna try and see how many euphemisms we can-- We're going to talk about it like, "I know you think this is a new dog, but it's really the same dog, he's just better now." Yeah, we're working on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Signal Boost. Our good friend of the show, David Nett, actually, his episode just went up today. David Nett, who is an amazing dungeon master. You can actually see him on Round Table, the new show that just hopped up on Alpha. He's also our trainer, who's been kicking our ass in the gym.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh man, it was so cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four sets of core sets.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did you take your shots?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I rised up when doing squats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Peggy, not happy to be there. Perfect.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And if you go to iTunes, you can get the Signal Boost ringtone for your phone and it's pretty great. Also, we have another surprise coming next week that I'm pretty stoked about, but you have to wait. No one probably cares. But I care.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so excited!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: YouTube it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Also, today was the episode of CelebriD&D.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a preview on YouTube and the full episode's on Alpha right now. Hopefully they'll bring it out down the road. With Joe Manganiello, who is legitimately an awesome guy. We got to know him pretty well through the process and he's a huge old-school RPG-- like, he GM'd GURPS and Rifts for years in the late 80s in a little comic shop. I would never have guessed. We nerded out extremely hard. He's one of my new favorite people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's pretty cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So check it out. We had a good time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And he had a cool hat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He had a cool hat and a fun character. And he got to play with a younger Keyleth and Percival in a one-shot that is technically Exandria-canon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was much happier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You were. I was not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now, lest I am mistaken, I think we're done. And that means it's time--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! No! Hey, look at this cool dice bag I have, it's got a bear!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- to start tonight's episode of Critical Role.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: [opening credits]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Met her father, expressed that the trial was complete, and the ceremony took place in which Keyleth was given the mantle and officially titled as the Voice of the Tempest, the now-standing leader of the Air Ashari. Which, by the way, I'm supposed to give you this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? Was that the thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You get another thing?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have your leadership feat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's your mantle!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's your mantle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I get another thing?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's nothing crazy. But it's fun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait. Is it a cloak? Don't you already have a cloak on?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a mantle, it only goes to here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I gave that cloak to Kerr--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Rothfuss jacked that cloak.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- who wore it away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Rothfuss jacked that cloak.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like to think there's a piece of paper like pinned to his wall right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He has the stats up there as a reminder? Framed? Please do that if you haven't already, Pat, please. So, after the ceremony is completed--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sorry, we're good. Carry on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Perfect timing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't feed them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After the crowning, the ceremony coming to a close, the evening's celebration kicks off and as the setting sun begins to darken the sky, the people of Zephra are now bringing out foods and treats and cakes, and they're putting up ribbons of blue and white and gold on some of the nearby trees and doorways. And the folks of the Air Ashari tribe now are in the process of enjoying both the return of their people and the fact that there is now a clear head of leadership, and you guys are now surrounded, basking in the afterglow of the event as well as deciding with slow-rising tension what you have as the next step in your journey. So, what would you guys like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Charge headlong into danger with no lessons having been learned from the previous sessions.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like it's day one. Vox Machina, let's do this!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Naked and running in full steam.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like right now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. No Vestiges, no nothing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Peace.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's our save game plus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But can I go talk to Keyleth, actually? I did want to ask you--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you allowed to leave? How does this work, exactly?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I'm the chief. I can do whatever I want, right? I don't know, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we talk to your dad?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I should maybe talk to Dad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How can I help you?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Korren, I was wondering if I could have a word with you for a minute?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. You do realise that you can still call me father. I mean, I know you're the "leader, but--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I? Is that allowed? I don't really know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, sorry."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You should fire that guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shitty servants.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's very windy up here. Don't worry about it."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, that's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you walk further away towards the tree, he takes his arm off from around your shoulder and says, "Now, I understand you have many questions and we've prepared you as much as we could leading "up to this journey you've gone on, but now you're here."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Primarily, the people of Zephra look to you for guidance when choices are hard, difficult."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You are the acting head of law, like I've been all this time. If there is conflict, if there "is difficulty, if there is a challenge that presents itself, that requires the wisdom of a "leader to step in--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's when you're called upon."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, (sighs) I'm confused. Was the Aramente my training to be a leader? You apparently prepared me as best as you could before I left, I don't know how well you all did (sarcastic laugh). So I'm just wondering if I need to expect that again, is this just me figuring this out again? Or do I have guidance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The nature of the Aramente is fluid. I have not taken it as I am not the leader. It is "tradition and it is both, as far as I understand, a series of challenges and lessons tailored to "whatever a person seems to be seeking or what you can draw from that, but also to interface with the "other tribes and establish that connection between all the leaderships."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did that (laughs). You're right, you haven't taken it, but that's been about 5% of my journey, all of the lessons that I've learned have been in the in-between.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is part of the Aramente itself."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. I guess... I don't know. Just trying to figure out how to navigate this, like the leader I'm expected to be. You know, Dad, you didn't tell me a lot about the world and sometimes I think I get angry at you for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're not wrong to have these thoughts."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why didn't you tell me that the world could be so cruel and mean? Why did you never tell me that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We tried, but you can only tell someone so much. Do you not think we spent days warning you "of the dangers and difficulty? We didn't thrust you out in the world with a smile, going 'have fun.' "We told you it was challenging, we warned you of the people you might interface with that "you couldn't trust. And for the first legs of it, we had a few scouts keeping an eye."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Just to make sure you were safe."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. It just sounds like it was advice coming from people who didn't really fully know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Every bird has to be kicked out of the nest for it to learn to fly. Not because we want to, but "because that's how things are."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, and I thank you for that. I guess I'm just wondering what's next. Now what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now, as leader of these people, you go and learn how best we can establish ourselves in this "countryside. Where once we-- (sighs) Gwessar, or Tal'Dorei as the humans call it, all of our "civilizations are merging. Isolation that we've relied upon is becoming less and less viable."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And so part of, I think, what you have already begun, is finding a way to bring not just "the Ashari, but Zephra as well, necessary friendships and allies."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our people need to be connected to the rest of the world that we've sworn to protect. I understand the need for our isolation but I often wonder if we had a few close allies on alert, if the Thordak incident might've have gone a little bit differently.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I agree."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I still need time, with Vox Machina. We still have things we need to complete. And then I promise I will return.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not bound to this mountain. Just know that "your heart is here, and we'll call for you if we need you. And when you're not needed beyond it, "this is your home."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, Dad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm proud of you." And his professional exterior falls away and he just steps forward and gives you a big, warm, fatherly embrace and just holds you there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, Dad. Thank-- okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry." He rights his posture, shoulders back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Another question. Do I have to wear this like all the time? It's a little unwieldy. It feels a little froufrou-y. Kind of ceremonial. It's just a little, feel like I'm going to trip on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You know, do what you like. It's yours."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. 'Cause going upstairs in it, like in the heels, it's a little unwieldy. I mean, it's beautiful! I'm going to go get a drink.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You probably should."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You read lips, what're they talking about?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah, they were talking all about you, actually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't believe you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why would they be talking about me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's this whole conversation about you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are full of shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I heard she was saying how much she admired you, and he was saying, "Er. I don't think "I feel it as much," and she was like, "No, really, Dad, you just need a chance to really talk to him," and he was like, "No, just believe me, I did talk to him, and I don't feel that way."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, I'm--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm so glad I confide in you. I have you to lean on. You are the rock in my life. What would I do without you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While she's talking I start to walk away, quietly as possible.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm so happy right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) So good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ah, deception.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, what do you want to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, figuratively or literally go to hell, I imagine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, are we doing this? Tomorrow morning, we're heading out to hell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, what're we going to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: First things first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: First things first what, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How do we get there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, she's got Plane Shift, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can get us there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very easily, actually. That's the easy part.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't take, like, a ship?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, sadly we can't.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No ships.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but we don't know exactly where we're going to land, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we know the city that we want to go to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can get us somewhere within the City of Dis. I don't know if--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dis city.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Built Dis city!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Man. This is going to go great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was too easy!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, when we went to the City of Brass, we did not shift into the City of Brass. We dumped quite a ways away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was, yeah. But on the outskirts.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. So we have no control over that, so--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could pop into it. We could pop out of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. So, whatever plan we come up with, one branch of the future is complete bullshit improvisation for if we fall into the shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So there's no planning for that. So if we don't fall into the shit and we land somewhere relatively safe, what're we going to do? How're we going to play this? This is hell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've been reading.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shocking.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. I've been looking into this, and it seems that where we're going has a very, very structured hierarchy. It's very ordered, the society makes sense, and wherever we find this creature that we have to slay, there will probably already be forces working against him that will be happy to ally with us to help that happen. They're vicious psychopathic creatures that only function because they maintain these rules with each other about how they're supposed to act.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's very ordered.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it would be possible to find people who would be delighted for outsiders to come in and do their dirty work for them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: However, Scalebearer, big high guy. Really important guy said not to make a scene. He said if we make a scene, that would go poorly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Says him. Psh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's no point for sextuplets. We can't do that. That's not going to work.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. They can see through things. It's going to be complicated as well because we have value as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I got it! We kidnap the president of hell and we assume his visage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's a president?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: His name is Asmodeus. And no, we are not kidnapping Asmodeus of Hell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think he's probably kind of powerful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's really heavy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Might be hard to lift him up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you seen him?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've seen sketches.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. Well, I mean, I don't know how correct these are--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Morning! Morning has come!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, wow!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, my.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: These are a power surge in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We talked all night and we squared it away and we're going to hell!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's very bright.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's going to be deals made.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So we're talking negotiation or bullshitting our way. One or the other--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be negotiating, probably with someone who'll give us cover if we do some dirty work.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, is it similar to the City of Brass? It sounds so similar.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They have a lot in common, yes. It's even more structured, though. There's quite a complex-- I alone have identified 13 different caste systems within their function.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caste systems?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's imps, spine devils, barbed devils, chain devils, bone devils. There's all these different kinds of devil, and each devil has to answer to a different devil. They answer specifically to the devils that have fealty over them, who in turn are at constant war with the devils who are in fealty to other devils, and archdevils, and greater devils, who in turn all owe their fealty to Asmodeus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we are not devils.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are not devils.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Therefore, weak and liable to be taken as slaves.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are not even slaves. We are consumables.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. I feel like we've gotten a bit of a reputation for ourselves. I'm sure that word has spread. We're not, you know--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would know this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, through your research. It's not terribly uncommon for mortals to wander through the City of Dis specifically because it is where goods, gold, and largely souls are traded to and from various structures or entities within the hells and beyond. To just consume or eat someone means nothing. The true worth of a soul is in corrupting it. And they do so through enticing, through corrupting their morals, through driving mortals through bargains and pacts to end up twisting into entities of order and evil as well, and then claim the soul of that. Contracts are a big thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, into a lemure, or other forms of soul-based energy. But contracts are a very, very important part of the whole economy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So the person that we made a contract with was a devil that ended up being the one that killed Pike, right? That was a devil disguised as a demon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ah, no. That was a demon disguised as a devil.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that was super confusing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Confusing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was the one that we wished our way out of the contract.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we don't really have that anymore.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was very proud of that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we don't have a wish. Okay, so we make no deals when we go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No deals. No contracts.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No deals. No contracts. No shaking of hands. No signing of anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No accepting of gifts.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Feel like I'm going to forget this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just don't touch anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no. Don't touch anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Might have to make you special gloves that don't have any fingers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got special gloves.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Even specialer gloves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like a muff.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That we can wear over those gloves.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like a what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're going to make me a special hand muff? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Taryon does pipe in, he's like--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We could put little ears on, we can make it like a kitten!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, but I've such fine handwriting! If we need to sign anything, just let me know. I'm happy to."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, Tary, no signing anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: My father used--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No signing of contracts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "-- to do contracts throughout the countryside."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Although I'm sure you're good at reading contracts as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is true!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. You can read them, but don't sign them. How about that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How about if I read them and I like it?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Unless you want to stay in hell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Agree to disagree."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we come back here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Your current contract with us actually stipulates that you can't have another contract enacted until you confer with all of us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Exclusivity.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes through his bag and pulls out the contract. "I stand corrected."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm very thorough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't even remember he signed a contract.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Doty, write this down. Be more careful about exclusivity in future contracts." (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think you were there. This might have been just him and me getting drunk at one point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there any worth to only a few people, or one or two, going in to get a lay of the land, once we get there? Instead of just moving in our truffle-shuffle normal formation.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like that could be very dangerous, for one person to go in alone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I agree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm very stealthy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Last time you were alone-ish, you almost killed two guards.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is the problem with that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In Vasselheim.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got away with it, right? Did we get caught? Did we get caught, Tary?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No! We did-- Did we get caught?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. I still have-- I only remember half of what happened."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tary is very excited about my plan. It's affecting his memory of what happened.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I think I blocked it out. But what I remember was interesting."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could always look in Doty's diary and find out exactly what happened.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, peruse the last 90 pages for the last hour.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Takes the book and starts thumbing through real fast. You look over at Doty who still has chunks and clusters of bits of red hair from the somewhat removed goatee.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fu Manchu?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. His secret goatee.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, Percy. We know a lot of things and people move through the Nine Hells. What does it say about rakshasas in there? Where do they fall in the caste?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It doesn't actually say where rakshasas would fall in the caste, does it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Succubi, incubi, they're a little bit outside of that system. There are other fiendish creatures that actually traverse between both the Abyss and the Hells based on what their interests are. So that's predominantly the structure of the devils that are--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In Dis?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, that are built within the Hells as their primary domain.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percy, help me understand, since you've read so much about this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good on you. So if the Raven Queen escorts souls-- If you're an absolute, terrible shit of a person and the Raven Queen escorts you over to the other side, we're going to be wandering amongst the souls of the damned? People who die go to where we're going?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If they're under contract, this is where they go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And many who sometimes aren't under contract go there as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you would know this, actually. The Raven Queen, as part of the laws of the cosmos that hold the various planes together, the Raven Queen does indeed escort good souls to the positive planes, the upper planes, and not-so-good souls to the lower ones.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Actually, I know that from reading a lot about the Raven Queen. I can answer that for you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you. I know they get escorted to the other side. It just seems like an odd idea to be walking in a city full of the thrown-away. I'm talking to the air right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we're absolutely listening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry. Keep going.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That changed the game forever.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I miss Scanlan Shorthalt so badly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because he listened to you so much more?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, he's just my buddy.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Aww.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Speaking of just our buddy--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As we move on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: -- Pike is another concern. I would feel far more comfortable making sure that she is definitely on board for this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that's difficult.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Phone a friend? What do we do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know. I've been thinking about that, the best way to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, Hotis-- How long has it been, DM?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Since?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Since Pike wasted his sorry ass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been, offhand, a couple of months.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know, I do bring it up, though, that it is one those things that we should talk about.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, if the fates allow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. I feel like we would have to find someone to Send Message.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There is a Message spell, maybe in the form of a text.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just blackmail the writers of Blindspot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ashley is in New York. (laughs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is one of those things where I thought I would just bring it up now before we go running in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I was just trying to guilt Matt into playing Pike, but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am okay with that too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's Ashley's character, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean we kind of did--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pike, Tary, what else? (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not the Thordak battle, there's not 87 miniatures on the board!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but I mean, it could be, we don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, well, we're all going to die.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'd also have to see if Ashley would be down with us, you know--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought I would bring it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- Kaiju-ing Pike once again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just thought I would bring it up--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys could Jaeger her again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: -- 'cause it is one of those things that is pretty clutch down there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not prepared, but we never are.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely. I'm liking it more.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, I'm curious, if-- Rakshasas aren't necessarily part of the system, and this guy tends to come in and out and just make people's lives a living hell. (laughs) Hell! We're going! Puns!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good. Slick.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The feeling I get reading-- the more I read about this place, is no one likes anybody down there, and so if we can figure out a way to be convenient about it, you can disappear anybody.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, didn't someone tell us that if they get trashed they are treated like shit there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's probably not well-respected.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've trashed his ass twice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When we went to the City of Brass we were owned, right? That's what let us move around so freely?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't have to do that here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you sure-- okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (sighs) I mean, we thought it was getting us around but it clearly wasn't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's nothing that we need to think about like that so that we have--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we should just go down, act like we're evils, like our souls have been claimed by another devil already.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly, the more we act like us, the more people are going to try to tempt us into things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could use Alter Self or try and change into something that's devil-y.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can't they see through that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They'll probably see through it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because that is an interesting question, because--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Illusions are different than actually physically changing yourself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. It's transmutation--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because Shapechange is considered a transmutation spell, whereas Seeming was an illusion spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seeming was an illusion. Illusions and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You actually become that thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know, the pit fiend you encountered is the only creature that saw through an illusion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, illusions and transmutation spells, things that actually physically alter your form, that's not considered an illusion. You are actually changing your physicality, so Alter Self would not be something that a creature with Truesight could see through.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I Alter Self to a succubus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you could alter yourself to look more--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To look like one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- like one. Maybe, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or like a tiefling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you wouldn't be able to give yourself wings.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are tieflings a thing in the City of Dis?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy, are tieflings a thing in the City of Dis?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ah, actually-- (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would I know? It's not on the page. You gave me one page.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you just think for a second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, I know. Well, before I gave you a basic structure and I am filling in the gaps as we go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, they are quite often found there. That is specifically a city that a lot of the social construct revolves around the cross-section between the mortal races and devils.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wonder if they have guides. I wonder if I can be like a tiefling tour guide for you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you could be our conduit, the person that brings us to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, like an ambassador, an escort.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Already have us under contract.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Already have you under contract.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you feel up to this level of deception? I say with all seriousness.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (inhales) You know it's not my strongest suit, and I recognize this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, wait, Tary. Do you have anything, like a spell you can make, any kind of trinket, (laughs) that would help Keyleth be better at lying?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, well, I do believe that I can enhance somebody's visage."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, not that, no. I'm talking an actual like ability to tell lies better. Something that would up her maybe charisma?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does he have Enhance Ability? Is that what you are talking about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He can give me Enhance Ability which means I would get advantage on checks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, yeah, I can give myself, you know, I can--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But I can do it as well, and probably a little better."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And Tary can do it as well. I'll talk into a mirror for a little bit, practice some things that tieflings might say. What are things tieflings say?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh God, I'm a tiefling. What happened? Why has this happened to me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Oh God, I'm a tiefling. What happened? Why is this happening to me?" See?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's perfect, that's perfect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's uncanny.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't believe you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are so close to being able to semi-retire and take it easy. We cannot cock this up. We're going to hell, we've no plan! What if we went and were completely honest, and were ourselves? And explained that we were here to remove the shittiest devil in the city?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seriously? Seriously?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am being serious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, he does have a slight point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We tried that. We've tried that. I mean, maybe it'll work. We just run willy-nilly. That's what we do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we do them a favor, it's not like we're saying--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm of the opinion that a bunch of mortals show up in the City of Dis looking for a rakshasa, I think they're going to be able to put two and two together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why? Yeah, they're going to know. I honestly don't think anyone's going to have a problem with us killing this guy. It's just a matter of do we want to be full Vox Machina? Because it might paint a giant target on us. Or maybe have someone as a silent escort? I could try and not speak a whole lot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, you could--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could just-- maybe I could be a mute escort? I had my tongue cut out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, I just feel like our-- certainly without Scanman-- our chances of fooling anybody are lower than they've ever been. So maybe having you as a tiefling escort gives a little credibility to the dummies there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's lots of people who're not dummies, though, and I feel like we should just quietly negotiate our way through, because I don't think we can bullshit, not without Scanlan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's very fair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I got lost, but I agree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you ever get a response from Sam on his potions? So, I didn't want to tell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Six regular, three medium, one superstar. If you need gold, I've got loads.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's literally right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. I didn't know you wrote it down, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Motherfuck--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, we gotta pass these potions out. Who wants a superior?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, do you have those potions?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, Tary gave them to me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They were gift-wrapped and everything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you steal them from me when I wasn't noticing? Because if you did I would have perceived it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I did, sorry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Perceived it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I would have. Because I have really high perceiving.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I thought that's why you wanted it gift-wrapped."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll take any-- I forget the sizes, is it venti, or grande?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want you dying again. Take the superior.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ooh, thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that all right with everyone?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, that's perfectly fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will say I did buy them, if I could also--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really, Tary? Because you have all those patches, I thought that's the reason you gave them to us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, but they're measly trifles of healing, I could use something--"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tary, how tough is that armor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The best that money could buy."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but is it ceremonial or is it like shit-kicker?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's functional."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want two regular potions, how is that, Tary? Is that good for you? In addition to your patches? Or would you want one of the greaters that you bought for us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Greater."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, all right, sure, take it back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughs) I'm so sad Sam couldn't be here for that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'll take a greater as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sure you don't want to give me one? Because I usually end up pouring it into one of you sloppy saps.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good call. Greater for Grog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a good idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So that's all three greaters taken.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take two regular if you've got them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Two regulars for Percy, two regulars for Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And that's-- well, that's two regulars left.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's like strapping a turkey baster to a tank, that's what that is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I would maybe just keep those or give them to Grog maybe, once again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Get up. (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have two regulars and one greater.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yarr.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fred, Freddie. Do we know what languages are likely to be spoken there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, good question.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does that say in your books?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you just call Percy 'Freddie'? I like it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He keeps calling him that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Infernal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's his name, isn't it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Frederick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Technically it would be a middle name.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you speak Infernal? Well, it is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do not speak Infernal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- your name, is it not? You have 37 of them, am I allowed to use any of ones between the first and the last?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am struggling to find a reason why not, which is somewhat irritating.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you prefer?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Percy is just perfectly reasonable.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about D-Roll?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about Von?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: D-Roll's pretty good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: D-Roll--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about Musel?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh jeez, I was just about to agree on it but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My god, you've found the line, and I've drawn it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know, D-Roll's pretty good. Man, D-Roll's great!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: D-Roll is actually pretty slick.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm suddenly extremely jealous of Grog for coming up with that name. Oh man, yeah, that's going to haunt you, my friend.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're just going to end up Wings someday, that's all I'm saying.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Y'all wanna stop and get a wing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Infernal. But they speak Common, I'm assuming, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know. You really don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah, shit. We don't know anybody who speaks Infernal, do we?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Tary.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about Zahra?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have any spells that help you be able to speak languages? Isn't there a spell called Languages?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not at the moment. However, if we have enough time, I'm sure we could go and find a local "class that teaches, maybe go to the Lyceum and we could learn the basics. Few weeks."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tary, do you want me to punch you in the face?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, I do not. Please, don't do that. Which, by the way, if we need any sort of healing--" And he rummages through his pouch here and says, "I can muster a couple of short-term potions if it "gets too bad."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why did you take one of the greaters if you can make healing potions on your own?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I can only really use one for myself, and I wanted a backup."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So Infernal is going to be a problem.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And we're taking Doty with us? Is that the plan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't see why we wouldn't. Why would we not want to bring him with us?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sure there's lots of robits in hell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does Doty speak Infernal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Doty doesn't speak."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can he write in Infernal?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is he a protocol droid?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is where it would be useful for Sam to send me his character sheet so I would know what languages he chose. But because Sam's not here, no. Doty does not know or speak Infernal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Somewhere an aerator's going (raspberry).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sam's stuff is right there, isn't it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that's my stuff. I'm spreading because he's not here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Understandable.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not really.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Man-spreading.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we tear off your sleeve and then you understand Infernal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, you don't need to do that."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could try.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would not recommend it."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I speak Disco, but not Infernal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sings) Disco Inferno.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not really that sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can't just off-the-cuff that. You've gotta save that for something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was for the Aladdin earlier. I had to do something in retaliation. We're looking to see if anything--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I speak Abyssal, but that's the other ones.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's the other guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, if I wanted to use Shapechange to actually turn myself into--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A succubus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- a succubus or a rakshasa, then I would speak Infernal because I do get that with-- we didn't really fully decide. It never specifies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because you get everything, but you just keep your intellect, wisdom, and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, do that!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You get a whole other language?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tight, then make yourself a succubus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no, you keep your intellect, it's not like you learn what the creature would know. So probably not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You automatically get those.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are the spells in the brain, though? Or in the body?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It doesn't specify in the spell. It's kind of what you decide.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It depends on what kind of spell. Like, elemental spells--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I really want to see what you look like as a succubus, personally.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do, too. This picture they have in the book is quite exciting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, she's got a whip.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, she does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any average example of that creature, one without any class levels or the spellcasting trait. So you don't get any spells. If you turn into something that has spellcasting, you don't get their spells. You maintain your intellect--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But I get their abilities.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get their abilities, their physical abilities and things they can do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, but that's different than knowing their language.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So I don't think you'd pick up a language.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. You get to suck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we may have to actually hire a guide once we're in there, then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we can't hire anyone! Why can't we just a hire a tiefling? Don't you have any other tieflings in your tribe?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe, but I imagine they would be super-rare.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You've been gone a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have any?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe ask dear old Dad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say for the purposes of-- thank you for the text. So, he checked on the languages that Doty knew.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, that's great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So there are two tieflings that exist in this society. They're pretty rare when it comes to Ashari, just because a lot of tieflings tend to not feel comfortable in some natural elements sometimes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them is about six years old. And the other predominantly works as a gardener in the vicinity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it's not a guarantee that they know Infernal, necessarily?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a guarantee, I don't think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could go ask.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could go ask. I mean, I could go and get a few buzz-words, you know--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's find that six-year-old.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- hello, goodbye, please, thank you, left, right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, most tieflings do learn Infernal as a language.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have been talking late into the evening, it's maybe one or two in the morning.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So go in the morning, find out. If not, we'll just go there and hope that someone speaks Common.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is called Common for a reason.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, Common. I feel like we'll be okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we can't sit here and wait for him to come back, we've just gotta fucking do it, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Unless-- I could try and talk to Dad, too, and see if he has anything that might help with languages, but I don't know. I think we'll be okay. We'll be all right, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's just hell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's just hell. It's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No big deal. Fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so do we have a vague plan? Should we sleep?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sleep, talk to the gardener.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But if we do this, we're done. We can take it easy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ish.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For a bit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To do what? What is left? The dragons are dead. All that's left is Hotis. What is left?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The fucking deal that I made with your fucking goddess. Who knows if she'll call us out on it, but.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I'm not going to run right back to the temple. Are you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, hell no. She creeps me out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I saw her face. It's fucking weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I saw that-- wait, you guys all saw-- we really talked to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that happened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That happened, you saw that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you know we saw her?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog, you saw that, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The giant white mask?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The giant white face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like Grog's getting more--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Indignant?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like you're lying more now than you used to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you want to do after this, Grog? Say we get back from hell. What's the next step for you? I mean, we're going to party, that's a given, but, like, are you done with the Herd?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It keeps disappointment low.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No expectations. I like it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, it's bad for goals, but yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Goals?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: High-five, buddy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (with a mouthful of drink) I don't have any plans, so I do anything and it normally works out great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Word.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There were words in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I actually understood it. How fucked-up is that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't need to see all the way to the horizon, right? You just gotta see right in front of your own little feet. You'll get there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. You remember that time a sword killed you? (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sometimes it gets cocked up, yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's got a point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He does have a point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is true. I mean, we're all here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Has anyone stopped to wonder why we're all still alive?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All the time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's fun. Good times, good times. What about you, Vex? What are you doing after we take a retirement?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wow, this is happening.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Good one, Grog. I mean, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, we knew that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to hopefully build up my small house.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You do have a small house if you're feeling--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Has it been built?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, it needs to be.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It needs to be. There's land.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 'Twill be.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, 'twill be. It's going to be lovely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 'Twill be lovely.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you going to be like Mr. Bates on Downton Abbey afterwards?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know who that is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Considering your idea of "small".

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was very nice before it caught fire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the sweetest before-we-all-die.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is, and the Grey Hunt itself is eventually going to be popping up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would love to know what that is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is the Grey Hunt, Percy? You keep saying what the Grey Hunt is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, bust that out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's your plans, Kiki?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whoa, whoa, back it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's nothing. It's nothing, is what it is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like the Grey Hunt is something really terrible and you just haven't told me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not terrible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bust it out, D-Roll.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, no, no, I mean, there's some boring bits of it, obviously.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, tell us the juicy bits of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it like paying your taxes, where it's not a real thing, but you kind of have to do it because it's on paper, and someone tells you to?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I get a jolly hat out of it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where does she learn this stuff? I've never--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I learned it from you, Percy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No guilt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Part of the Grey Hunt-- and this happens not every season, but often on Winter's Crest festivals, and again it is an official title and does actually carry with it some responsibilities beyond that, but they're very, very you, they'll be fine-- is, and I can't give too much of it away because part of the ritual is also--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god! Tell us something!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You are going to have to go into the woods, and meet something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's making this up as he goes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm really not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Meet something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You go into the woods, there are creatures that live in the woods that have been affected by the land, that have gained some--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're going to shroom your tits off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I get really high? Is this the whole point of the Grey Hunt?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whitestone. There are things within the earth of Whitestone that have certain power and certain energies, and they have been seeped into the plants and the stones and the animals themselves, and your job will be--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I have to find the highest animal in the woods?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: More or less.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am starting to regret that I asked. What's the punchline?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The punchline is you're going to go and you're going to have to actually bring back a kill, and it will be a very specific kill that is asked for.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But part of that then gives you a practically divine right to manage and look after the creatures of the woods, and our hunting, and what is reasonable to be killed, and otherwise. I think I'm covering most of it--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do you mean divine? Like she can see things? If she kills the radioactive beast does that mean she gets radioactive powers?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Divine more in the sense of what reasonable people do to tell commoners that we're allowed to talk to them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. That's not as fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Less exciting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I go alone or do I get help?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You do go alone. No, you do not get help.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's so cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're so fucking transparent sometimes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sounds fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think you're going to do very well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you'll be fine!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I look forward to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's killed tree beasts and dragons, she's fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everything under the sun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tree beasts or three beasts?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Both!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look, my light-up 20 just lit up for no reason as we were talking about it. I think it'll go very well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It'll be a lovely Winter's Crest. We haven't had a master or mistress of the Grey Hunt in many, many, many years.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, what are you going to do when we take a break, Percy? You still haven't answered the question.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know. I mean, I think I'm going home. I say "I think." I'm going home. There will be work to do there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't look at me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I have plans for my city. I have plans for the people. I want to make it great again. I want to make it shining, beautiful, comfortable for everyone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, I might need your help. I have a few ideas for the Ashari tribes as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that that would be an excellent thing, for our two people to communicate very regularly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think they need to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think they must.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you help me build some sort of, maybe like, alarm system?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That sounds very expensive, I'm not sure that that's possible. Yes, of course I can help you with something like that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay! But with taxpayer's money. Also something else you taught me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It will be a string on a bell. You're learning so well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, just two cups on a string.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we go to bed?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we all sleeping in this hut, or do we have separate huts? We're all sleeping in this hut, aren't we?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Welcome to your yurt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it all water outside still? Like, a little bit of water on the ground? No. We're not there anymore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's windy. You're up on a cliff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog is very drunk at this point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So drunk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's so much water outsi-- (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you guys do have separate places to stay. People clear out in clusters, you have your own locations to sleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why does it smell like mayo?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's gross.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Taste of choice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is mayo! Take that!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's just been drinking mayo. (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Takes a strong constitution.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is vile! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's probably not kept well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's so gross. All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Goodnight, lovely people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As morning comes around, you all come to consciousness. The village of Zephra is already come to life. You can see that the townspeople are up and about, they're handling their business. The guard's being tended to. You can see the Windriders are already out, leaping from mountain peak to mountain peak, doing their perimeters in the vicinity. The children are up and being led to their various outdoor classes. The city is alive, and your business is your own.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I get information on that gardener and where to find him. Or them. Or she. Or he. I don't know who they are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. It's easy enough to find, in this city in particular a tiefling sticks out like a sore thumb. You see a woman, probably in her-- it's hard to tell with a tiefling, demon don't crack. But she's a little older, she's in her 40s probably. Dark purple skin, the horns curl backward and come to almost a singular point behind--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you all hold hands, and you complete the ritual, the incantations leaving your lips, your vision suddenly grows dark as the magics of the spell pluck you from your home plane and thrust you into the space between.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Before you, a glow begins as you rocket towards an unexpected and incredible sight: an endless permeable tapestry, a tangled lattice of burning, divine fire appears before you, writhing and growing as you shoot towards it with incredible speed. You instinctively wince and curl, a promise of impact triggering your need to defend yourself, the dread as the air begins to heat around you. Then-- whoom-- you impact and pass through harmlessly, the heat fading. You glance over your shoulder to see it gone. You just passed through the Divine Gate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Divine Gate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear them crackling in the distance as they shove along their tortured charges. As you glance up past them, you see the sky now: dozens of winged shadows glide through the air across a greenish, cloudy, barely lit sky that flashes with far distant cracks of lightning, occasionally brightening darker shapes, larger, looming in the distance. But one that draws your eye like a terrible dream, unable to look away upon noticing it, is an impossibly colossal tower of black iron and lead, stretching for hundreds of miles into the sky before vanishing into the dark, clouded expanse above you. You blink and turn around to look at the other side of the horizon, but there stands the exact same tower. You shift around; no matter your view of that horrid horizon, there stands the Iron Tower, the throne of the archdevil, Dispater, standing ever-vigilant over his Iron City of Dis. And that's where we're going to take a break.
